timeline.bodyText: Why is this changed to false? Class generated with Annotator has it true
timeline.author: manusa

replies.bodyText:
Actually, I think this flag is for generating sundrio helper classes again. In kubernetes-model-core, we use KubernetesCoreTypeAnnotator which sets generateBuilderPackage=true, rest of the models are simply depending on kubernetes-model-core so we don't need to do it in this case.
Earlier everything was under one module that's why earlier it's generateBuilderPackage was set to true
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText:
These builders may actually be used by client users. If builders were being generated before, they should be still be generated. So KubernetesTypeAnnotator should set generateBuilderPackage=true too in order not to break compatibility.
Or is there any reason why this flag was set to false in KubernetesTypeAnnotator?
replies.author: manusa

replies.bodyText:
By builder helper classes, I didn't mean builder itself. I meant these

If you look at extensions' model they are using kubernetes-model-core and they have generateBuilderPackage=false. That way these classes won't be generated again and would be consumed from kubernetes-model-core
replies.author: rohanKanojia

replies.bodyText:
👍  nice explanation.
This may also help when dealing with the java 9 modularization.
replies.author: manusa
